title: [GAME] Sion loses use of Q and R in ARAM
body:
while playing {{champion:14}}  in ARAM i encountered a bug where i could not use his Q or R. it happened about 8 minutes into the match. after that i could no longer use the abilities. clicking them or using the keyboard would result in a audible response sound but no action would occur for me or anyone else. i will be attempting to recreate the incident. at some point around the 8 minute mark and my second death. i've tried to recreate the event but i have yet to be successful in solo play. i thought it might be caused by charging into a tower/item build/death count. nothing has worked. i'm thinking it might have been an interecation between champions but i'm unsure of which ones would trigger it.  

this is the match it happened in. i have no idea how to recover the data/replay or even if you record it. (something dota does that i think would be a good idea). [](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1712726246/36677357?tab=overview) 

if anyone has any suggestions in how i could possible recreate this bug or how i could be more helpful please leave a comment.

Edit: the link didn't go through here it is http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1712726246/36677357?tab=overview

replies.body: Hey Elonth, this is a bug we are looking to fix, but I honestly can not provide a time frame to when. This issue is typically reproduced when using 'normal' cast while pressing Q and R at the same time. You can easily work around this issue by using Smart Cast. I hope this helps :(
Something similar to this happened to me while playing as Xerath on an ARAM, except I couldn't use my Q.  Should changing to Smart Cast prevent this in the future?
I was wondering why I've never run into this issue since it seems like everyone has it happen so frequently. Smart cast OP.

Why not just diable Sion until this is fixed? Sure, he's loads of fun in ARAM, but I'd rather not have a chance to play him than roll him and be unable to play the game.
